record.title: BENNETT FREEZE REPEAL ACT
record.narrative:
BENNETT FREEZE REPEAL ACT -- (Senate - September 18, 2008)

[Page: S9165]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of Calendar No. 967, S. 531.

record.chair: The clerk will state the bill by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (S. 531) to repeal section 10(f) of Public Law 93-531, commonly known as the "Bennett Freeze."
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the bill.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the bill be read the third time and passed, the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table, and that any statements relating to the bill be printed in the Record.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The bill (S. 531) was ordered to be engrossed for a third reading, was read the third time, and passed, as follows:
Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,
Section 10(f) of Public Law 93-531 (25 U.S.C. 640d-9(f) is repealed.
